title: On cards listing, credit card pay day is showing the numbers of days after closing for payment
description:
**Current behavior:** The credit card listing shows the raw payment_due_day value (e.g., '10 days') instead of the actual calculated payment date.

**Expected behavior:** Should display the actual payment due date (e.g., '15') based on the statement closing date + payment_due_day calculation.

**Location:** Payment methods / cards listing page

title: Future installment being calculated as part of the current month spends in the dashboard
description:
**Current behavior:** Future installment payments are being included in the current month's spending calculations on the dashboard, making budget totals inaccurate.

**Expected behavior:** Only installment payments within the current statement period should be included in spending calculations. Future installments should not affect current month totals.

**Impact:** Budget dashboard shows inflated spending, leading to incorrect financial awareness.

**Location:** Dashboard spending calculation / budget progress widgets

**Related:** Discovered while investigating installment deletion bug (lv-expense-tracker-9ar)

title: When a user deletes a credit card installment, child installments are staying in the dashboard
description:
**Current behavior:** When a user deletes a credit card installment (parent transaction), the child installment records remain in the database and continue to appear in the dashboard.

**Expected behavior:** Deleting the parent installment should cascade delete all associated child installment records.

**Impact:** Data integrity issue - orphaned records pollute the dashboard and may affect budget calculations.

**Location:** Installment deletion flow (both frontend and WhatsApp bot)

title: Receita recorrente não aparece no dashboard
description:
Quando um usuário adiciona uma receita recorrente, ela deveria aparecer no dashboard no mesmo dia todo mês. Atualmente, a receita não aparece no dashboard no mês seguinte.

**Comportamento esperado:**
- Receita recorrente deve aparecer automaticamente no dashboard a cada mês
- Deve manter o mesmo dia configurado (ex: dia 5 de cada mês)

**Comportamento atual:**
- A receita recorrente não aparece no dashboard após o primeiro mês

**Impacto:**
- Usuários não conseguem visualizar suas receitas recorrentes corretamente
- Dashboard mostra informações incompletas sobre o fluxo de caixa
